<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Martial Artist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2018) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 182 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67)

</column>

---

You have trained to use your fists as deadly weapons. The damage die for your fist unarmed attacks becomes 1d6 instead of 1d4. You don't take the –2 circumstance penalty for making a lethal attack with your [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) unarmed attacks. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency rank in all unarmed attacks.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the martial artist archetype.

<title level="2">Martial Artist Dedication leads to...</title>
[Follow-Up Strike](/Feats.aspx?ID=2019), [Grievous Blow](/Feats.aspx?ID=2020), [Path of Iron](/Feats.aspx?ID=2021), [Powder Punch Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=3575)
name: Martial Artist Dedication
